citeinfo.origin: New Hampshire. Department of Environmental Services
Central New Hampshire Regional Planning Commission
Southern New Hampshire Regional Planning Commission
citeinfo.title: Key Destination Areas New Hampshire 2006
NH GRANIT Database
citeinfo.origin: New Hampshire. Department of Environmental Services
University of New Hampshire. Complex Systems Research Center

descript.abstract:
This polygon dataset shows significant retail areas containing numerous potential destinations in New Hampshire.
The data was developed by the nine Regional Planning Agencies based on a common methodology, with input and review from staff at the NH Department of Environmental Services. Certain types of destinations were identified for all communities; these included: Elementary Schools, Middle Schools, High Schools, Higher Education Facilities, Municipal Offices, Libraries (public and private), Community Facilities, Grocery Stores, Athletic/Recreation Facilities, Post Offices, Retail/Shopping Areas, Public Transportation Access Point, and Hospitals. Additional destinations were identified when significant to a community; these could include such places as Smaller Markets, Places of Worship, Restaurant, Funeral Homes, Performing Art Centers, Trail Access Points, Town Greens, and Large-scale Event Facilities. Destinations are identified separately by type. Descriptions and additional information is provided for some data.
descript.purpose: This dataset is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.

cntorgp.cntorg: New Hampshire Department of Environmental Services

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

dataqual.logic: The data is checked for errors and checked for positional accuracy based on 1998 USGS Digital Ortho Quadrangles, 2003 NAIP imagery and/or USGS Topographic Quadrangles. The data is spatially clean having no topological errors or other kind. The data was reviewed by both the regional planning associations and NHDES.
dataqual.complete: The data are complete as of the publication date. Any additions or changes to the destinatins will be updated as the need arises.

procstep.procdesc: Central New Hampshire Regional Planning Commission (CNHRPC) Base data collected from existing community master plan documents and GPS data. Additional destinations were delineated from 2003 NAIP imagery.

Lakes Region Planning Commission (LRPC) Polygons were created where multiple Destination Points fell within a small area, such as a mall or a single structure. The outline includes the parking associated with such structures and was determined using 2003 NAIP imagery.

Lakes Region Planning Commission (LRPC) Polygons were created where multiple Destination Points fell within a small area, such as a mall or a single structure. The outline includes the parking associated with such structures and was determined using 2003 NAIP imagery.

Nashua Region Planning Commission (NRPC) Polygons were derived from assessing data, aerial imagery and existing local plans. Areas were designated as destination polygons based on the Sprawl Indicators criteria.

Rockingham Planning Commission (RPC) Retail/Shopping areas were reselected from RPC's Land Use dataset and from the 1998 Land Use dataset of Rockingham County as produced by the CICEET funded Land Use Change Study done by GRANIT, Complex Systems Research Center, UNH. Features were plotted on aerial photo base maps for staff review and comment. Additions and corrections were made per staff comments.

Southern New Hampshire Regional Planning Commission (SNHRPC) The individual towns within the region were sent a copy of the printed map of the last version of sprawl indicators to make changes to the existing or add any new indicators to the data. Planner from SNHPC has also set up meetings to discuss and map the new indicators with community planners from the individual towns. The 2004 color aerial photos where used to map the exact location of the marked indicator. The data is also georeferenced and is also attributed with information.

Strafford Regional Planning Commission (SRPC) Destinations were digitized on top of 1998 USGS Ortho-photos according to the methodology created by the Sprawl Indicators working group. Original data was reviewed/updated with 2003 NAIP Imagery.

Southwest Regional Planning Commission (SWRPC) Destinations were digitized on top of 1998 USGS Ortho-photos according to the methodology created by the Sprawl Indicators working group at 1:8,000 scale.

Upper Valley Lake Sunapee Regional Planning Commission (UVLSRPC) Destinations were digitized by UVLSRPC based on 1992 or 1998 Digital Orthophoto Quads (DOQ's), from the US Geological Survey and the USDA Forest Service, 1:12,000, distributed by GRANIT. Other destinations were GPS'd by UVLSRPC, funded by NH Office of Emergency Management.
North Country Council (NCC) Destinations were digitized by NCCRPC based on the NAIP 2003 Digital Orthophoto Quads, from the USDA Aerial Photo Field Office. 1 Meter Resolution.

NHDES collated the destomatopms from each Regional Planning Association. NHDES reviewed each submittal for consistency in how the data was presented and what attributes needed to be collected. The data was returned back to the RPAs for corrections.

Name of dataset was changed from KeyDestinations_polys to NHKeyDestinationAreas06.
This shapefile metadata was edited for clarity and keywords were added per Tufts metadata standards.

attracc.attraccr: Attribute information remains the same as given by the author of the data. However, when information is missing or ambiguous, the GIS Information Systems Center at Tufts University researches other metadata sources for explanations. If sufficient information is unavailable, "unknown attribute" is given as the definition. If the attribute has been created through a geoprocessing function, "geoprocessed identifier" is given. If the attribute is known, but the values are not, "unknown" is given for values. Features' units of measurement are determined if not already given
